main event: Mr. and Mrs. Vern Vermilyea observed two bright lights in the sky while hunting in Tupper Lake, N.Y. in Fall 1963.
interesting points: The lights appeared to be hovering and pulsating,The couple watched the lights for about 15 minutes,The lights were located approximately 40 to 50 yards above the ground,No photographs were available for circulation,The case is currently under investigation and the reported objects remain unidentified.
sighted object: two bright lights in the sky
witness description: Mr. and Mrs. Vern Vermilyea, who were hunting at the time
